bibl.title: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to Henry Rose Carter, September 27, 1923

div1.p: Kelly sends Carter a copy of his Walter Reed book. He notes the credit given Carter's work in Ross' memoirs and asks for photos of Carter to include in a collection of malaria and yellow fever literature he is gathering for the School of Hygiene, in Baltimore.

div1.head: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to Henry Rose Carter, September 27, 1923

opener.dateline:
HOWARD A. KELLY, M. D.
LIBRARY
1406 EUTAW PLACE, BALTIMORE, MD.
CABLE ADDRESS, “HAKELLY”, BALTIMORE
September 27, 1923. Thursday

div1.p:
The Walter Reed volume is out at
last, and I am sending you a copy, anxious that it
meet your approval in the correctness of the statement
of facts and that you consider that I have given the
story in its proper balance with due credit to all
parties in this important vital matter.

It has been a great pleasure to me
in reading Sir Ronald Ross' “Memoirs” to see that your
work is duly appreciated. If you have not a copy of
these memoirs, it would give me great pleasure, if you
will drop me a line, to send you a copy with my compli-
ments.

May I ask that you send me a picture
of yourself, and if you have one of yourself as a
younger man, I shall even make so bold as to ask for
one of those. My purpose in doing this is an endeavor
I hope I am going to make to gather together all the
literature on this important subject -- malaria and
yellow fever -- with autographed letters, pictures,
etc., for our School of Hygiene here in Baltimore.
in a special department dedicated to this
